revision.text:
{{Merge to|Cyber-attack|date=November 2015}} {{confusing|date=June 2011}} A '''cyberheist''' is a type of computer crime committed by [[Computer crime#Cyber terrorism|cyber criminals]]. Recently observed cyberheists have become more and more sophisticated. These attacks have been promulgated on enterprises through the use of phishing that targets employees with access to their computer systems. Using such attacks cybercriminals can bypass the [[antivirus]] security software and use ''[[Social engineering (security)|social engineering]]'' to coax information out of their victim or they can simply wait for the employees to click on something in their computers. When employees click on something in their computers, the criminals get access to the computers. They then [[Hacker (computer security)|hack]] into the network and put [[Keystroke logging|keylogger]]s on [[Accounting information system|accounting systems]]. In time the cybercriminals are able to obtain password and keys information. An organizationâ€™s bank accounts can then be accessed via the information they have stolen using the [[Keystroke logging|keylogger]]s.<ref>{{cite web|last=Krebs |first=Brian |url=http://voices.washingtonpost.com/securityfix/2009/10/avoid_windows_malware_bank_on.html |title=Security Fix - Avoid Windows Malware: Bank on a Live CD |publisher=Voices.washingtonpost.com |date= |accessdate=2011-06-23}}</ref>
In May 2013 a gang carried out a US$40 million cyberheist from the [[Bank of Muscat]]. <ref>[http://onlinenewsoman.com/2013/05/17/indian-companies-at-center-of-global-cyber-heist/ Indian Companies at Center of Global Cyber Heist]</ref>
